story:
Once upon a time, in a land far, far away, there was a kind and loving king who ruled over a prosperous kingdom. This king had a young son named Prince Lucas, who was known throughout the land for his bravery, compassion, and love for animals.

One day, Prince Lucas was out exploring the woods near the castle when he came across a small, trembling bird with a broken wing. The prince gently picked up the bird and cradled it in his hands, whispering words of comfort and reassurance.

Prince Lucas knew that he had to get the bird help, so he rushed back to the castle and sought out the wise old healer who lived in the castle's gardens. The healer examined the bird and told the prince that he would need special herbs and flowers to mend the bird's broken wing.

Prince Lucas was determined to find the ingredients for the healing potion, no matter what it took. He searched high and low, through meadows and forests, until he finally found every herb and flower on the healer's list.

The healer mixed the ingredients together and created a beautiful, shimmering potion. He gave it to Prince Lucas, who carefully fed it to the injured bird. To the prince's delight, the bird's wing began to heal and strengthen before his very eyes.

But the prince knew that the bird would need more than just a healed wing to survive. He asked the healer if there was anything else he could do to help the bird. The healer smiled and told the prince that the bird would need a safe and loving home, where it could grow strong and learn to fly again.

Prince Lucas knew just the place. He took the bird to his own private garden, where he had built a cozy little nest for it to rest in. He fed it and cared for it, and soon the bird was strong enough to fly again.

Prince Lucas was overjoyed to see the bird soaring through the sky, free and happy. He knew that he had done a good deed, and that the bird would always remember him as a friend and a hero.

And from that day on, Prince Lucas made it his mission to help all creatures, big and small, and to always show kindness and compassion to all living things.

The end.

Now my dear son, it is time to close your eyes and drift off to sleep, knowing that you too can make a difference in the world, just like Prince Lucas. Goodnight and sweet dreams.
